page.title: 18Ainsdale dune life
page.content: In a{dune slack}we found brookweed, creeping willow, pennywort, early marsh orchid and marsh marigold. The dune helleborine grows here. Sea milkwort, a small pink plant, spreads a thick mat in sand. There was some "cuckoo spit" with a 1mm long frog- hopper inside. Most plants cannot survive as salt prevents their roots from absorbing water. In a pond we found a dull black, worm-like leech. Moving, it was 10cm when extended but 5cm when contracted. We put a dead frog in the pond for the rare natter- jack tadpoles to eat. They were 2cm long and had not yet developed legs. In{dune heath}you have to dodge prickly yellow-flowered gorse and purple heather tickles your legs. It is common to see a rabbit, its long ears sticking up, scampering in the dune grass.
